verses.roman:
eṣa tvānirdaśaṁ sindhāv
akṣipac chambaro 'suraḥ
matsyo 'grasīt tad-udarād
itaḥ prāpto bhavān prabho

synonyms: eṣaḥ—he; tvā—You; aniḥ-daśam—not yet ten days old; sindhau—into the sea; akṣipat—threw; śambaraḥ—Śambara; asuraḥ—the demon; matsyaḥ—a fish; agrasīt—devoured; tat—its; udarāt—from the belly; itaḥ—here; prāptaḥ—obtained; bhavān—You; prabho—O master.
translation: That demon, Śambara, threw You into the sea when You were not even ten days old, and a fish swallowed You. Then in this very place we recovered You from the fish's abdomen, O master.
